entry.title: Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
entry.content:
• Status changed from author action to initial review
  • Assignee changed from Richard Hughes-Jones to Greg Newby

Dear Guy,

Thanks for this. It is ready for public comment. I would like to wait to release it for public comment at the same time as the recommendation track document (tracker #251).
- Greg Newby

entry.title: Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
entry.content:
• Status changed from initial review to public comment
  • Assignee changed from Greg Newby to Andre Merzky

Heading for public comment.

entry.title: Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
entry.content:
• Assignee changed from Andre Merzky to Greg Newby

comment tracker has been created at https://redmine.ogf.org/projects/editor-pubcom/boards/23 and can be announced.

entry.title: Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
entry.content:
• Status changed from public comment to author action

Document has completed its public comment period. Group and area director should please review and advise was to whether this is ready to proceed to final GFSG review.

entry.title: Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
entry.content:
• Status changed from author action to final review

Group and area director advise that they are happy with the document as it stands after expiration of the public comment period. The GFSG has reviewed this and believes the document is suitable for publication.

Greg, if you concur, please provide a GFD number and initiate publication.

entry.title: Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
entry.content: • Status changed from final review to to be published

entry.title: Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
entry.content:
• Assignee changed from Greg Newby to Andre Merzky

The standards council has approved publication. This will be GFD-I.217.

Andre, please process and post, and then I will announce.

Thanks to the authors/editors for your efforts on this document! Greg Newby

entry.title: Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
entry.content:
• File NSI Signaling and Path Finding public comment_final.docx added
  • Status changed from to be published to author action
  • Assignee changed from Andre Merzky to Richard Hughes-Jones

The document missed some of the standard sections (security considerations, IPR, author info). I added the sections, but some need to be filled out. I am not sure how I / we missed that before, sorry for that...

I append the iterated version, please use that for final changes. Thanks!

entry.title: Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
entry.content:
Dear Guy, others:
    It's not clear whether this is the final version ready for publication, or not. Please check the most recently uploaded document, and let us know.
    - Greg

entry.title: Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
entry.content:
• File NSI Signaling and Path Finding public comment_final_Apr2015.docx added

Hello Greg,

Thanks for spotting the missing sections and adding the relevant headers. I have now updated these sections - please see the attachment.

Regards,
Guy

entry.title: Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
entry.content:
• Status changed from author action to to be published
  • Assignee changed from Richard Hughes-Jones to Andre Merzky

Thanks. This is now ready for publication as GFD-I.217. Once Andre posts, I will announce. Congratulations to the group for this successful process.
- Greg

entry.title: Editor - document #250: Network Service Interface Signaling and Path Finding
entry.content: For some reason, my microsoft office does not allow me to premanently change the document header, neither on title page nor the other pages. It always changes back when I export to PDF... I do not know my way around office very well, sorry for that -- but could one of you guys please update the headers and export to PDF? Otherwise all is done, and the doc is published, and can be announced -- I'll update the pdf as soon as I get one...
